articles.title: Day of the Sun Commemorated in Different Countries
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Secretary General of CILRECO
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Secretary General of CILRECO 
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a letter sent by Guy Dupre, secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea (CILRECO) on Mar. 26 on behalf of the attendants of its presidium meeting held in Brussels.
 The attendants congratulated the Korean people for successfully frustrating the aggressive moves of the U.S. imperialists to block the process of national reunification under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il and highly praised his Songun politics for its contribution to the defence of security, stability and peace in the Korean Peninsula and region, the letter said, and went on:    
 The attendants sternly denounced in the name of the CILRECO the U.S. belligerent hostile policy towards the DPRK. 
 They clearly stressed that the reunification of the Korean nation and the peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula can never be achieved as long as the U.S. forces remain in south Korea as the root cause of interference in the internal affairs of Korea and the constant threat of a new war in the Korean Peninsula.
 Therefore, the action program for 2006 of CILRECO and a declaration to the world public adopted at the meeting called for extending more positive support and solidarity to the Korean people in their efforts for reunification and peace of the country.
 The attendants said that the world conference for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea held in Pyongyang last year was an important occasion which confirmed the absolute support of the world people for the just cause of the Korean people, and warmly congratulated the achievements of the conference.
 All the attendants, greatly inspired by the brilliant successes made by the Korean people last year under your distinguished leadership, vowed to more positively contribute to the struggle for Korea's reunification in the future and expressed the firm belief that the noble cause started by President Kim Il Sung will surely be accomplished.

Foreign Guests Visit International Friendship Exhibition
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Visit International Friendship Exhibition 
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of various embassies here visited the International Friendship Exhibition on April 6 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 They paid tribute to the wax replica of President Kim Il Sung in unbounded reverence for him.    
 They looked round gifts Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il received from state and party leaders, political and public figures and people from all walks of life in different countries.

articles.title: Presidium of CILRECO Meets
Day of Sun Marked at Syrian Embassy
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked at Syrian Embassy 
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Muhammad Adib Al-hani, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Syrian embassy here, hosted a reception at the embassy Thursday to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
 He said in a speech that President Kim Il Sung always lives in the hearts of not only the Korean people but the world progressives struggling for freedom and independence for his great exploits performed in the struggle to accomplish the human cause of independence.    
 The friendly relations between the two countries provided by former President Hafez Al-Assad and President Kim Il Sung are growing stronger under the deep care of President Bashar Al-Assad and leader Kim Jong Il, he noted, wishing the Korean people greater progress and prosperity.    
 Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, in his speech said that Kim Il Sung fathered the immortal Juche idea and built a powerful socialist country, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence, adding that he was a political elder who performed undying exploits in the efforts to accomplish the human cause of independence.
 The DPRK will as ever extend full support and solidarity to the Syrian people in their just cause of defending the country's sovereignty and the national dignity and strive to boost the friendly relations between the two countries, he stressed.
 Present at the reception on invitation were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Jong Chang Ryol, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
 A staff member of the Syrian embassy was on hand.

Rally for Independent Reunification Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rally for Independent Reunification Held in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A rally for independent reunification was reportedly held on Jeju Island on April 1 to inherit the spirit of the April 3 People's Resistance for independence under the co-sponsorship of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration and the preparatory committee for the Jeju Solidarity for implementing the joint declaration in south Korea.
 A resolution read out at the rally said that the April 3 People's Resistence on Jeju Island was a sacred one that displayed the spirit of the Korean nation for independence against the U.S. and its will to achieve national reunification. 
 The U.S. is seeking to break the will of the Korean nation for reunification by rendering the situation strained through large-scale war exercises, but the spirit for unity and reunification between the north and the south of Korea is growing stronger, the resolution said, adding: The Korean nation will surely open up a new era of peaceful reunification under the banner of independent reunification, peace against war and great national unity.

Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a congratulatory letter by the military attaches' corps here on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of his election as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
 It was handed to an official concerned on Friday by Giraldo Abreu Morales, military attache of the Cuban embassy who is doyen of the corps.
